meanings.definition: A circle of constant longitude passing through a given place on the earth's surface and the terrestrial poles.
meanings.sent1: The map showed the meridians running from north to south.
meanings.sent2: Sailors used the meridians to navigate the vast oceans.
meanings.sent3: The meridians on the globe seemed like colorful ribbons wrapping around the Earth.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the meridians were like invisible threads connecting all lands.
meanings.sent5: The concept of meridians made geography class more interesting and understandable.

meanings.definition: A great circle on the celestial sphere passing through the poles of the heavens and the zenith of a given place.
meanings.sent1: Stargazers often refer to the meridians when observing the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The meridians in astronomy help locate stars and planets accurately.
meanings.sent3: The meridians in the sky looked like pathways for the stars to follow.
meanings.sent4: The idea of celestial meridians made her feel closer to the universe.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the meridians in space left her in awe of the cosmos.
